SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am07
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am07.utils.matrix

Class Matrix<T>

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am07.utils.matrix.Matrix<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements in the matrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<T>
public class Matrix<T> extends Object implements Iterable<T>, Serializable
A matrix of generic type T. It is implemented as a list of elements, with a fixed number of rows and columns. The matrix can be extended in any direction, and the elements are initialized to a default value.
Author:
Roberto Alessandro Bertolini
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Matrix

      public Matrix(int rows, int columns, T emptyValue)
      Create a new matrix with the given number of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows
      columns - the number of columns
      emptyValue - the default value for every element of the matrix (can be null)

    • Matrix

      public Matrix(int rows, int columns)
      Create a new matrix with the given number of rows and columns. The default value for the elements is null.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows
      columns - the number of columns

    • Matrix

      public Matrix()
      Create a new 0-sized matrix. The default value for the elements is null.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public T get(int x, int y)
      Get a specific element
      Parameters:
      x - the row index
      y - the column index
      Returns:
      the element at the position (x, y), or the default value if the position is out of bounds

    • getSubMatrix

      public Matrix<T> getSubMatrix(int x, int y, int rows, int columns) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Get a sub-matrix of the current matrix, starting from the given position and with the given number of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      x - the row index of the starting position
      y - the column index of the starting position
      rows - the number of rows of the sub-matrix
      columns - the number of columns of the sub-matrix
      Returns:
      the sub-matrix of size (rows, columns) starting from the position (x, y)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of rows or columns is invalid

      public void set(int x, int y, T value)

    • logicAnd

      public void logicAnd(Matrix<T> other) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Logic AND operation between two matrices. The result is stored in the current matrix.
      Parameters:
      other - the other matrix to use for the operation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the two matrices have different sizes

    • clear

    • containsShape

      public boolean containsShape(Matrix<T> other)
      Check if two different matrices have the same shape, i.e. the same number of rows and columns and the same position of empty elements.
      Parameters:
      other - the other matrix to compare
      Returns:
      true if the two matrices have the same shape, false otherwise

    • match

      public boolean match(Matrix<T> other, T wildcard)
      Check if two different matrices are equal, element by element
      Parameters:
      other - the other matrix to compare
      wildcard - a value to ignore when comparing the elements
      Returns:
      true if the two matrices are equal, false otherwise
